newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Richina says 98 pct of issue taken up.
newsitem.headline: Richina says 98 pct of issue taken up.

text.p: Richina Pacific Ltd, formerly Mainzeal, said on Tuesday that 98 percent of its one-for-eight rights issue had been taken up.
The remaining shares in the $6.3 million issue had been taken up by underwriters, primarily local institutions.
New share certificates in the name Richina Pacific would be issued to all shareholders at close of business today.
The $6.3 million raised by the rights issue and $14.6 million from a placement will help fund Richina Pacific's investment in a walkthrough aquarium in Beijing.
Construction, which has an estimated cost of $26 million, has already commenced and is due for completion in mid 1997.
Part of the underwater world involves acquiring Riddell Associates Ltd through the issue of 4.6 million shares.
Upon completion of funding and the acquisition, Richina Pacific will have 231,119,891 shares on issue.
